intro: Grammatotheca bergiana var. pedunculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. It is widely cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. The species is known for its ability to thrive in indirect light and well-draining soil.
